author: CelsoKelso

text:
Huh, just did a good amount of research. It's a detective visual novel game. This is played during the final battle per say, since it's all visual no actual battles so, in essence, one could say this is a sleuthing theme, the music that plays when the lead is proclaiming all the facts and finally laying down the truth as to who the murderer is.
In such case, this is easily the best sleuthing theme ever. Professor Layton and Phoinex Wright have nothing on this epic revelation. Case closed.

text: @Arc13 I mean, even with games soundtracks I love such as Castlevania, Pokemon, Kingdom Hearts to name a few, I still need to hear it multiple times, play the level, get a certain ways into the song or some combination of the above to love the song. I actually wasn't big on FFVI's music until I plopped myself down long enough to hear it start to finish and now it ranks admist my top 10 soundtracks of all time. So I think it says something when as picky as I am I love this so soon. Great job!
